albums.title: Whatever People Say I Am, That's What I'm Not

jobs.title: Software Engineer II
jobs.description: In this role I am primarily working as a full-stack developer, though I enjoy working on the front-end and getting involved with accessibility efforts.

jobs.title: Full-Stack Software Developer, MyChart
jobs.description: I had the opportunity to lead and participate in several large-scale, multi-release projects.  I was responsible for managing, designing, and implementing major new functionality for users. I made significant contributions to COVID-19 vaccination efforts in MyChart in unprecedented circumstances. Consistently ranked as a top performer on my team.

jobs.title: Technology Analyst Intern
jobs.description: During my internship at Credit Suisse, I worked as part of a small, agile team to create a financial data chatbot. I was responsible for implementing the web-scraping functionality and the integration with third-party machine-learning services such as Microsoft QnAMaker and LUIS.

jobs.title: Undergraduate Research Assistant, Dr. Williams
jobs.description: I contributed to on-going projects and research centered around security and security education. My primary tasks were to explore tools that could aid the research team, configure and maintain test environments, and quantify results. I am a co-author on a paper that was accepted to ICSE-JSEET 2021 as well as a paper that was accepted into the Empirical Software Engineering Journal.

jobs.title: Undergraduate Research Assistant, Dr. Shen
jobs.description: In collaboration with Lawrence Livermore National Labs, I explored and quantified the results of different memory allocation techniques in high-performance computing clusters using CUDA C.

jobs.title: Database Development Intern
jobs.description: During my internship I re-wrote an internal export tool and improved the runtime over the previous solution by over 90%.

projects.name: echo-machine
projects.description: My latest endeavor. Stay tuned to find out more.

projects.name: Cloudinator
projects.description: Senior Design project at NC State led by Michael DeHaan, the founder of Ansible.We created an open-source automation platform to allow developers to more easily deploy and configure their Linux-based applications on various cloud platforms such as AWS and GCP. I was responsible for implementing the APIs for various AWS resources such as Load Balancers, Auto-scaling Groups, implementing deployment logic such as Blue/Green and Rolling deployments, and implementing various network topology elements such as Bastion Hosts and custom VPC configurations.

projects.name: Vibecheck
projects.description: Single-page web app that leverages Spotify APIs to allow users to sign-in with their Spotify accounts and visualize audio features of their playlists.

projects.name: Valerium
projects.description: Network Security was one of my favorite classes that I took as an undergrad, and one of the things we learned about in that class was blockchain technology. I found myself inspired to learn more about how cryptocurrencies use blockchain technology and tried my hand at creating my very own simple cryptocurrency in Python! Valerium is the result of that effort, it is a simple cryptocurrency that allows users to commit transactions, mine blocks, and reach consensus via Flask endpoints. It's not feature-complete or anything like that, but rather a small proof-of-concept to improve my own understanding. Buy, buy, buy! Valerium to the MOON!!!

projects.name: Rendezvous
projects.description: At PackHacks 2019, myself and three of my best friends created an app called Rendezvous which won the competition's MLH 'Best Use of Snapkit' Award! We used Swift and the new Creative Kit from the Snap API (which had released only ten days prior) to prototype a calendar app that allowed users to auto-generate unique stickers for their selected calendar events and post them to Snapchat.
